# ITC 36: Call for Papers

The INTERNATIONAL TELETRAFFIC CONGRESS (ITC) 36 will take place from **June 2 to June 5, 2025**, at the **Norwegian University of Science and Technology, Campus Trondheim, Norway**. The conference theme is **Sustainable Digital Infrastructures**.

ITC 36 solicits original contributions that address the latest changes and developments in the design, modelling, measurement, and performance evaluation of communication systems, networks, and services. Objectives include energy-efficiency and sustainable IT, network security and privacy, QoS and QoE, and resilience.

# ITiCSE 2025: Call for Papers

Welcome to the ITiCSE 2025 Call for Papers. This page provides detailed information about paper submissions. Please read the general [Call for Participation](https://iticse.acm.org/2025/call-for-participation/) first. For questions, please [contact the program chairs](mailto:iticse2025papers@easychair.org).

## ITiCSE 2025 Paper Tracks

Papers submitted to ITiCSE address aspects of computing education. Submissions are divided into three tracks:

1.  **Computing Education Research:** Papers defining research questions, describing data gathering and methods, presenting results, and discussing contributions to knowledge in computing teaching and learning.
2.  **Experience Reports and Tools:** Papers describing computing education experiences, including tools developed for computing education, with sufficient detail for adoption. These should be motivated by literature, highlight novelty, and describe what worked and what didn't.
3.  **Position Papers and Proposals:** Papers articulating original and well-argued positions on computing education or proposals for early-stage work. These must offer value to the community, even if the work is not yet completed.

All papers must explicitly state motivating questions, relate to relevant literature, and include an analysis of intervention effectiveness if applicable. **Initial submissions must be anonymous.**

## Submission Process

### Abstract Submission

*   A mandatory abstract submission is required for all papers.
*   Abstracts can be up to **250 words** and must be submitted as plain text.
*   **Deadline:** Sunday, January 12, 2025.
*   The abstract helps reviewers bid for papers they are qualified and interested in reviewing.

### Full Paper Submission

*   **Deadline:** Sunday, January 19, 2025.
*   **Anonymity Requirements:**
    *   The paper submitted for review **must be fully anonymous**.
    *   Remove all identifying references: author names, affiliations, any information in the body or headers that might identify authors or institutions (e.g., websites, publications, geographic locations).
    *   Omit acknowledgements that might identify authors.
    *   Self-citations should be worded to prevent reviewer identification (e.g., "An early experiment in this area was carried out in 2018 [13]" instead of "We reported on our first experiment in 2018 [13]").
    *   If presenting software, anonymize its name.
    *   Leave space for author names, affiliations, and ACM reference format, or ensure the paper is short of the page limit.
    *   **Do not include links to additional material** (e.g., software demonstrations) in the review version.
    *   Submissions to sites like arXiv should use a different title and abstract than the review version to maintain anonymity.
*   **Formatting Requirements:**
    *   Maximum of **six pages plus one page for references**.
    *   Text in figures and tables must be readable at 100% magnification and in greyscale.
    *   File size must be no more than 10MB.
    *   Use the ACM SIG Proceedings Template (LaTeX or Word).
    *   Refer to the [Formatting requirements](https://iticse.acm.org/2025/call-for-participation/#formatting) on the Call for Participation page for details.
*   **Ethical Status of Data Collection:** Submissions using data from human participants must indicate if approval has been granted, by what authority, and its scope. Unapproved data use must be clearly explained.

## Important Dates for Papers

*   **Mandatory abstract submission:** Sunday, January 12, 2025
*   **Full paper submission:** Sunday, January 19, 2025
*   **Author notification:** Monday, March 3, 2025
*   **Camera ready deadline:** Sunday, November 16, 2025

*All submission deadlines are 23:59 AoE – Anywhere on Earth (UTC-12).* 

## Submission and Contact

*   Follow the instructions on the [Submission process](https://iticse.acm.org/2025/call-for-participation/#process) page.
*   Convert the final anonymous version to Adobe PDF format, checking PDF properties to ensure no identifying information is included.
*   Upload the PDF via the online submission system.
*   **Note:** ITiCSE 2025 is a face-to-face conference. At least one author must register, attend in person, present, and participate in discussions for the publication to be included in the proceedings.

**Questions regarding paper submissions should be addressed to the program chairs:** [iticse2025papers@easychair.org](mailto:iticse2025papers@easychair.org).

# ITS2025: Call for Papers

The International Conference on Intelligent Tutoring Systems (ITS2025) is the upcoming conference in the series of Intelligent Tutoring Systems Conferences focusing on Computer and Cognitive Sciences, Artificial Intelligence, and Deep Learning in Tutoring and Education. ITS2025 will be held in **Alexandroupolis, Greece, from June 02 to June 06, 2025**, and will be co-hosted by Democritus University of Thrace.

The conference will be **hybrid**, allowing participants to attend online as well.

## Conference Theme

"**Generative Systems**"

Generative Intelligence concerns AI systems, techniques, architectures, methods, or tools based on deep and machine learning which can be used to generate texts, images, solutions, and environments, able to enhance HUMAN intelligence, cognitive capacities, memory, and learning.

## Conference Tracks

*   **T1: Generative Tutoring Systems**
*   **T2: Generative Systems in Healthcare Informatics**
*   **T3: Generative Systems in Human Interaction, Games and Virtual Reality**
*   **T4: Neural Networks and Data Mining**

*   **T6: Security, Privacy, and Ethics in Generative Systems**

## Submission Categories

*   **Full papers:** Twelve (12) pages
*   **Short papers:** Eight (8) pages
*   **Posters:** Six (6) pages

# Call for Papers: IWCIA 2025

IWCIA 2025, the twenty-third International Workshop on Combinatorial Image Analysis, invites submissions of original research relevant to the workshop's scope. The workshop will be held in a **hybrid mode** with its base in **Szeged, Hungary, from September 24-26, 2025**.

The scientific program will consist of keynote talks and contributed papers. The conference proceedings are approved for publication by **Springer in Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)**.

## Scope

Image analysis is a scientific discipline providing theoretical foundations and methods for solving problems appearing in a wide range of areas, as diverse as medicine, robotics, defense, and security. As a rule, the processed data are discrete; therefore, the “discrete approach” to image analysis appears to be a natural one and has an increasing importance. It is based on studying combinatorial properties of the considered digital data sets. Combinatorial image analysis often features various advantages (in terms of efficiency and accuracy) over the more traditional approaches based on continuous models requiring numeric computation.

The Workshop is a forum for current research on the following (or similar) research subjects which are directly or potentially applicable to image analysis:

*   Combinatorial problems in the discrete plane and space
*   Lattice polygons and polytopes
*   Digital/combinatorial geometry and topology
*   Digital manifolds
*   Geometry of digital curves and surfaces
*   Analysis and processing of digital surfaces with singularities (such as “pinched digital surfaces”)
*   Homotopy of digital manifolds; thinning algorithms and skeletons
*   Boundary tracking of digital solids; Geometric characteristics of object boundaries
*   Multigrid convergence analysis of metric-based descriptors
*   Tilings and patterns; Combinatorial pattern matching
*   Computational geometry and imaging sciences
*   Integer programming, linear programming, and graph theoretic models and approaches to problems of image analysis
*   Image representation, segmentation, grouping, and reconstruction
*   Processing “very large” digital pictures; Methods for image compression
*   Parallel architectures and algorithms
*   Fuzzy and stochastic image analysis
*   Discrete tomography
*   Grammars and models for image or scene analysis and recognition; cellular automata
*   Mathematical morphology and image analysis
*   Applications in medical imaging, biometrics, computer vision, image understanding, robotics, metrology, and others
*   AI and machine learning in imaging and image analysis

## Submission Guidelines

*   **Eligibility:** Submitted work should contain only results that are unpublished and not included in other work considered for publication elsewhere.
*   **Format:** Manuscripts must be prepared according to the LNCS requirements and submitted electronically in **PDF format**.
*   **Length:** The submitted paper must be at least **10 pages**.
*   **Submission System:** Submissions must be made using **Microsoft CMT** via [https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IWCIA2025](https://cmt3.research.microsoft.com/IWCIA2025).
*   **Review Process:** Papers will be reviewed thoroughly with an emphasis on potential to contribute to the state-of-the-art in the field. Each paper will receive at least **two double-blind reviews** to ensure maximal objectivity.
*   **Selection Criteria:** Will include mathematical depth, accuracy and originality of the ideas, clarity and significance of the results, and presentation quality.
*   **Authors' Guidelines:** Authors should consult [Springer's author's guidelines](https://www.springer.com/gp/computer-science/lncs/conference-proceedings-guidelines) for paper preparation.
*   **Copyright:** The corresponding author of each paper must complete and sign a Consent-to-Publish form.
*   **Presentation Requirement:** A paper will be included in the proceedings only if at least one author (regular or online) registers and pays the registration fee, and attends the workshop to present the paper.

# Call for Papers: IEEE/ACM IWQoS 2025

We invite the submission of manuscripts presenting original research results to the **IEEE/ACM International Symposium on Quality of Service (IWQoS) 2025**, which will be held from **July 2-4, 2025**, in **Gold Coast, Australia**.

Quality of Service (QoS) has long been a central focus for communications and networking researchers worldwide. Emerging domains such as the Internet of Things, data centers, virtualization, cloud and fog computing, green computing, and artificial intelligence are driving a new wave of research into service guarantees related to QoS, Quality of Experience (QoE), Quality of Protection (QoP), Software Quality, Data Quality, and, more broadly, Quality of Information Technology.

For over two decades, IWQoS has established itself as a premier forum for presenting novel ideas on all QoS-related subjects. The **33rd International Symposium on Quality of Service (IEEE/ACM IWQoS 2025)** aims to continue this tradition as an international platform for the presentation and discussion of cutting-edge research in the field. The scope of IWQoS encompasses both the latest theoretical advancements and experimental research papers.

# Call for Papers: KEOD 2025

The **International Conference on Knowledge Engineering and Ontology Development (KEOD)** is a key event within **IC3K, the 17th International Joint Conference on Knowledge Discovery, Knowledge Engineering and Knowledge Management**. KEOD 2025 will be held from **October 22-24, 2025**, at the Barceló Marbella hotel in Marbella, Spain.

KEOD is sponsored by INSTICC – Institute for Systems and Technologies of Information, Control and Communication.

### Scope

**Knowledge Engineering (KE)** encompasses the technical, scientific, and social aspects of building, maintaining, and utilizing knowledge-based systems. It draws on AI, databases, expert systems, decision support systems, and software engineering, integrating insights from logic, cognitive science, and socio-cognitive engineering. Recent advancements include Large Language Models (LLMs) for automated ontology generation and Low-code/No-code Platforms for greater accessibility.

**Ontology Development (OD)** focuses on creating reusable semantic structures like vocabularies, glossaries, and formal ontologies. These are essential in applications such as knowledge graphs, digital twins, explainable AI (XAI), cybersecurity, and IoT interoperability. Ontologies are also crucial for ethical AI development, mitigating bias, and enhancing transparency.

KEOD aims to be a major meeting point for researchers and practitioners interested in methodologies and technologies related to KE and OD, encouraging the exploration of cutting-edge topics.

### Conference Topics

*   Applications and Case-Studies
*   Automated Ontology Learning and Evolution
*   Domain Analysis and Modeling

Welcome to KES-AMSTA-25, the **19th International KES Conference on Agents and Multiagent Systems - Technologies and Applications**. AMSTA-25 is an international scientific conference for research in the field of agent and multi-agent systems. Agents and multi-agent systems are related to a modern software paradigm which has long been recognized as a promising technology for constructing autonomous, complex and intelligent systems.

Consisting of keynote talks by experts in the field, oral and poster presentations, KES-AMSTA-25 will provide an excellent opportunity for researchers to discuss modern approaches and techniques for agent and multi-agent systems and their applications, as well as intelligent systems in the field of social networks, self-organisation and trust.

## Submission Conditions

## Publication Files

# Call for Papers: KR 2025

The 22nd International Conference on Principles of Knowledge Representation and Reasoning (KR 2025) will take place from **November 11-17, 2025**, in **Melbourne, Australia**. KR is a well-established and vibrant field of research within Artificial Intelligence, focusing on explicit declarative knowledge representation and semantically grounded inference mechanisms.

KR 2025 will be co-located with CPAIOR 2025, ICAPS 2025, and NMR 2025.

## Conference Tracks and Calls

KR 2025 will include several tracks and calls for participation:

*   **Main Track:** Focuses on core principles of knowledge representation and reasoning.
*   **KR in the Wild Track:** Submissions demonstrating practical applications and real-world use of KR.
*   **KR&R in Planning & Scheduling Track:** Explores the intersection of knowledge representation and reasoning with planning and scheduling.
*   **KR and Constraints Track:** Addresses the interplay between knowledge representation, reasoning, and constraint satisfaction.
*   **Video Track:** Submissions showcasing KR concepts or systems through video demonstrations.
*   **Recently Published Research Track:** For papers already published in reputable venues.
*   **Tutorial and Workshop Proposals:** Opportunities to organize educational sessions and specialized discussions.
*   **Doctoral Consortium Applications:** A forum for PhD students to present and discuss their research.

# KV – Knowledge Visualization and Visual Thinking: Call for Papers

The Knowledge Visualization and Visual Thinking (KV) Symposium is dedicated to exploring contemporary methodologies and applications that enhance the creation, communication, and management of knowledge through visual means. Incorporating advancements in Artificial Intelligence (AI), the symposium aims to foster interdisciplinary discussions on how AI-driven visualization techniques can transform knowledge processes across various domains.

## Themes

This call for papers seeks original papers and contributions concerning, but not limited to:

### AI-Enhanced Knowledge Visualization

*   Integration of AI to automate and improve visualization design and data processing.
*   Utilizing machine learning for dynamic and adaptive knowledge representations.
*   Exploring AI’s role in personalizing visual content to user-specific needs.

### Visual Thinking in Complex Systems

*   Developing visual tools to simplify and manage complex information structures.
*   Employing visual metaphors and models to facilitate understanding in multidisciplinary collaborations.
*   Case studies demonstrating visual thinking applications in problem-solving and decision-making.

### Cognitive Aspects of Visual Knowledge Transfer

*   Investigating how AI-driven visualizations impact cognitive load and information retention.
*   Designing visual interfaces that align with human perception and learning processes.
*   Evaluating the effectiveness of interactive visualizations in knowledge dissemination.

### Collaborative Visualization Tools

*   Creating AI-supported platforms that enhance collaborative knowledge creation and sharing.
*   Assessing the role of real-time visual analytics in team-based environments.
*   Innovations in shared visual spaces for remote and co-located collaboration.

### Ethics and Accessibility in AI-Driven Visualizations

*   Addressing ethical considerations in the deployment of AI for knowledge visualization.
*   Ensuring accessibility and inclusivity in AI-enhanced visual tools.
*   Discussing the implications of AI biases in visual knowledge representation.

Please check the submission procedures @ the [submission page](http://iv.csites.fct.unl.pt/pt/call-for-papers/important-dates/).

# Logical Foundations of Computer Science (LFCS) 2022: Call for Papers

LFCS 2022 was held in an **online format** from **January 10-13, 2022**.

## About LFCS

The LFCS series provides an outlet for the fast-growing body of work in the logical foundations of computer science, e.g., areas of fundamental theoretical logic related to computer science.

# Call for Academic Software Demos

We welcome proposals for in-person demos of academic, open, free, and non-commercial software. The software may or may not be directly associated with accepted ISBI 2025 papers and abstracts, but should still have relevance to accepted ISBI 2025 work. The academic demo sessions of ISBI 2025 will aim to showcase recent developments in the field, software used in ISBI 2025 papers, all relevant to the ISBI community. This will be an opportunity for presenters to perform live demos of their code/software while interacting with conference attendees face-to-face.

## Focus Areas

Demos should focus on **open science, reproducible research, clinically-translational work, and soft skills development**. Demos should provide material for all levels of expertise, including students, early career scientists, professionals, and clinical users. Demos should primarily focus on the (relatively mature) tools developed by the presenters rather than results.

## Demo Format

*   All accepted demos will be **in-person** in an assigned conference hall during the main conference.
*   Each demo will be provided with a **small table, power outlet, wireless (shared) Internet, and a monitor** during its assigned time slot.
*   Submissions should list all other supporting equipment that will be needed per demo, so the conference committee may do their best to arrange them.
*   Demo presenters are expected to bring their own laptops/PCs as needed for their demo.

## Demo Fee

*   There will be a **$140 fee** for the demo package (table, poster board, screen, power connection).
*   This fee must be paid upon registration by the presenter of the relevant paper the demo is attached to, who will be attending the conference, in addition to their conference attendee fee.

## Demo Proposal Requirements

Proposals should be **no more than one (1) page** in 12-point font submitted as a single PDF file. Demo proposals should contain the following sections:

*   **Title:** Must have the prefix "Demo:" (e.g., "Demo:<Title>"). Include a brief topic overview and brief expected learning outcomes.
*   **Representative Image:** One "representative image".
*   **Relevance to ISBI community:** Emerging topics will be favorably considered if the link with the ISBI community is clearly established (the software is associated with an accepted ISBI 2025 paper or abstract).
*   **Software URLs:** List any GitHub or otherwise public software related URLs.
*   **Target Audience:** Describe from which areas potential participants are expected to visit the demo, what prior knowledge or skills are expected from the audience, and what software or programming languages might be involved.
*   **Presenter Information:** (Not included in page limit) Please provide names, affiliations, positions, and email addresses for each demo-presenter.

## Important Dates

All deadlines are 11:59pm USA (PST).

*   **Demo proposals due:** **February 24, 2025**
*   **Accept/Reject notification:** **February 28, 2025**
*   **Deadline to submit any update on requested materials needed:** **March 7, 2025**

## Demo Submission

All demo proposals need to be submitted via Google Form.

If you have any questions or concerns, please email: [SJSujit@mdanderson.org](mailto:SJSujit@mdanderson.org).

## Other Submission Types

Links are also available for:

*   [Author (1-Page Papers)](https://biomedicalimaging.org/2025/reviewer-guidelines-and-instructions/author-1-page-papers/)
*   [Camera Ready Submission (4-Page Paper)](https://biomedicalimaging.org/2025/camera-ready-submission-4-page-paper/)

# IWANN 2025: Call for Papers

The 18th International Work-Conference on Artificial Neural Networks (IWANN 2025) will be held in **A Coruña, Spain, from June 16-18, 2025**. This biennial meeting aims to provide a discussion forum for scientists, engineers, educators, and students on the latest discoveries and realizations in the foundations, theory, models, and applications of systems inspired by nature, as well as emerging areas, using computational intelligence methodologies.

## Submissions

IWANN 2025 accepts three types of submissions:

*   **Full Papers:** Maximum 12 pages in Springer LNCS format. Must contain original, unpublished work. Accepted papers will be published in Springer LNCS proceedings.
*   **Extended Abstracts:** 2 pages in Springer LNCS format. Must contain original, unpublished work. Accepted abstracts will be published in a Book of Abstracts.
*   **Published Paper Showcase:** Presentation of a previously published journal paper (JCR indexed or similar). Submitted proposals will be reviewed for topical relevance and, if accepted, will be referenced in the Book of Abstracts.

At least one author of each submission must register, pay the registration fee, and attend the conference.

Submissions can be made to the **General Track** or to one of the **Special Sessions**. New Special Session proposals are also welcome.

**Submission Link:** [Easychair](https://easychair.org/conferences/?conf=iwann2025)

## Topics

Submissions are invited on topics including, but not limited to:

*   Mathematical and theoretical methods in computational intelligence
*   Deep Learning
*   Learning and adaptation
*   Emulation of cognitive functions
*   Bio-inspired systems and neuro-engineering
*   Advanced topics in computational intelligence
*   Agent based models
*   Time series forecasting
*   Robotics and cognitive systems
*   Interactive systems and BCI
*   Machine Learning for 4.0 industry solutions
*   AI Health
*   AI in 5G technology
*   Social and Ethical aspects of AI
*   General Applications of AI

## Publication

Proceedings will be published with **Springer-Verlag** as **Lecture Notes in Computer Science (LNCS)**. Extended versions of selected papers will be published in special issues of prestigious journals.

## Awards

**Best Poster** and **Best Presentation Early Career Researcher Awards** are sponsored by PeerJ. Winners will have their Article Processing Charges waived for PeerJ journals.

# LAK25: Call for Papers

The 2025 edition of the **International Conference on Learning Analytics & Knowledge (LAK25)** will take place in-person in **Dublin, Ireland**, from **March 3-7, 2025**.

LAK25 is organized by the Society for Learning Analytics Research (SoLAR) with Technological University Dublin (TU Dublin). The conference theme is **"Expanding the Horizons of Learning Analytics."**

## General Information

*   LAK is a collaborative effort by researchers and practitioners to share rigorous, cutting-edge work in learning analytics.
*   The field continues to grow, with LAK25 welcoming the largest number of full paper submissions and an increase in practitioner submissions.
*   LAK has received a **CORE ranking of A** and is among the **top 20 Google Scholar citation ranks for educational technology publications**.

## Conference Theme and Topics

Submissions are welcome from both research and practice, encompassing theoretical, methodological, empirical, and technical contributions.

### Expanding the Horizons of Learning Analytics:

Authors are encouraged to address questions related to:

*   **Expanding our Theoretical Perspectives:** Bringing new theoretical lenses and deepening connections to existing theoretical approaches.
*   **Expanding the Types and Complexity of Data:** Multisource and multimodal data paired with relevant and pedagogically valid data fusion strategies.
*   **Expanding our Methodological Toolbox:** New ways to collect and analyze data, design learning analytics interventions, and evaluate impact. Special attention will be given to novel uses of Generative AI.
*   **Expanding our Delivery Mechanisms:** Going beyond traditional dashboards and data visualizations.
*   **Expanding our Ethical Considerations:** How learning analytics contributes to a more just and inclusive future.
*   **Expanding our Approaches to Responsible Data Use and Analytics:** Ensuring privacy protection and trustworthy analytics.
*   **Reaching out New Populations and Stakeholders:** Diversifying participants and expanding geographical and cultural reach.
*   **Rethinking the Learning Analytics practice:** Empowering stakeholders in co-designing, leading, and executing learning analytics processes.

*Note: Authors are not required to address the theme; acceptance is not based on theme fit.* 

## Usual Topics of Interest:

*   **Implementing Change in Learning & Teaching:** Ethical issues, adoption strategies, scalability, equity, fairness, and transparency.
*   **Understanding Learning & Teaching:** Data-informed learning theories, insights into specific learning processes, modeling, and systematic reviews.
*   **Tracing Learning & Teaching:** Evidence of learning, assessing student learning, analytical and methodological approaches, and technological infrastructures.
*   **Impacting Learning & Teaching:** Human-centered design, decision support and feedback, data-informed decision-making, personalized and adaptive learning, and practical evaluations.

## Submission Tracks:

*   **Research Track:** Focuses on scholarly knowledge advancement through rigorous research studies. Accepts full research papers (up to 16 pages) and short research papers (up to 10 pages).
*   **Practitioner Track:** Shares real-world learning analytics implementations. Accepts Practitioner Reports (2-4 pages).
*   **Posters & Demos:** For concise reports of recent findings or innovative work. Accepts Posters (3 pages) and Interactive Demos (200 words abstract + 5 min video).
*   **Workshops & Tutorials Track (Pre-Conference):** For new and emerging ideas. Accepts Workshops (4 pages) and Tutorials (4 pages).
*   **Leadership Academy (Pre-Conference):** [See Leadership Academy Call](https://www.solaresearch.org/events/lak/lak25/leadership-academy/). Submission Deadline: **October 7, 2024**.
*   **Doctoral Consortium (Pre-Conference):** [See Doctoral Consortium Call](https://www.solaresearch.org/events/lak/lak25/doctoral-consortium/). Submission Deadline: **October 7, 2024**.

## Submission Guidelines

*   **General Submission Link:** [https://www.solaresearch.org/events/lak/lak25/submission-guidelines/](https://www.solaresearch.org/events/lak/lak25/submission-guidelines/)
*   **ACM Format:** LAK follows ACM’s 1-column format for submissions. Published Proceedings will appear in ACM 2-column format.
*   **Templates:** Available on the [LAK25 Submission Guidelines Page](https://www.solaresearch.org/events/lak/lak25/submission-guidelines/).
*   **Companion Proceedings Template:** [SoLAR companion proceedings template](https://www.solaresearch.org/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/LAK25_Companion_Proceedings_Template.docx)

## Review Process

LAK25 uses a **double-blind peer review process** for all submissions except demos, pre-conference events, the doctoral consortium, and the leadership academy.

A **rebuttal phase** is provided for full and short research papers.

## Proceedings Publication

*   Accepted full and short research papers: included in LAK25 conference proceedings published by ACM.
*   Other submissions (posters, demos, workshops, tutorials, practitioner reports, doctoral consortium): included in the open access LAK companion proceedings on the SoLAR website.
*   **At least one author of each accepted submission must register by the Early Bird deadline** for the paper to be included in the proceedings.

### ACM Open Access Model:

Authors based at institutions not part of the ACM Open program may need to pay an article processing charge (APC).
